introduction.vision: To be recognized as a premier business university whose graduates competently and confidently serve the nation of Kenya, the East African region and the global community.
introduction.mission: To offer high quality, integrated and market driven teaching, research and extension services in a safe and supportive academic environment.
introduction.philosophy: It is the philosophy of the University that all human beings have a role to play in the society and that each person is uniquely endowed with the necessary abilities to fulfil their role.
coreValues: Excellence - do it right first time
Integrity - carry out our business with honesty and openness
Diversity - no discrimination on the basis of ethnicity, gender, social, economic or religious backgrounds
Innovation - seek new ways of creating, sharing and applying knowledge; and continuous learning and improvement
Commitment - committed to understanding and meeting the needs of our students, faculty, alumni and partners
Service to the Community - interact with the community and participate in the development and implementation of solutions to community opportunities and problems
Recognition and support of individual talents - support individuals to make their own contributions
introduction.historicalBackground: KCA University dates back to 1989, with the establishment of the institution as Kenya College of Accountancy by the Institute of Certified Public Accountants of Kenya (ICPAK) charged with mandate to improve the quality of accountancy and financial management training in the country. Starting in rented premises in Westlands, the University's main campus is now on Thika Road at Ruaraka with enrollment of over 5,000 students annually.

studentWelfareServices.description: The Dean of students' Office co-ordinates all Students' welfare matters in the University, be they personal, academic, spiritual or social with the assistance of the Students Association of KCAU (SAKU).
studentWelfareServices.sakuOfficeLocation: Fifth floor of the Tuition complex

counsellingCenter.description: The counseling Centre promotes students' personal development, emotional and psychological well-being, in a professional and confidential setting.
counsellingCenter.cost: Free of charge in a confidential and non-judgmental manner

services: Mobile V.C.T clinics on monthly basis
Referrals for complicated cases to Avenue health care
Insurance policy for students injured through sporting activities

cafeteria.description: Meals and soft drinks available at subsidized prices

accommodation.description: The University does not provide accommodation to students but has made arrangements with hostel owners and has a list from which students can select and make their own arrangements on the payment of the rent.

transport.description: KCA University has buses that students use for activities including authorized trips, sporting and club events. Students interested in using the bus should pay for the vouchers using the standard payment procedure and pick them at the Administration Managers office in Block B.

clubGuidelines.registrationRequirement: All societies and clubs must be registered with the Office of the Dean of students
clubGuidelines.patronRequirement: Each society must have a member of staff (teaching or administrative) as a patron
clubGuidelines.fundingSource: Allocation from the SAKU fee and University approved fundraising

saku.description: An association comprising of all registered students and operates in accordance with the SAKU constitution and in compatibility with the philosophy and regulations of the University.
saku.governance: Governed by the SAKU Council which is an elected group of students' who represent the students' welfare to the Management
objectives: Use lawful, proper and prudent means to ensure members' aspirations and interests realized
Promote students' welfare and safeguard students' rights and freedoms
Seek and undertake representation in organs of the University
Work in solidarity with other students' organizations
Enhance freedom of conscience, expression, association, and academic liberty
Encourage student academic research and development of artistic and professional talents
Nurture student's responsibility, leadership qualities and other talents
Develop positive attitude towards community through community service
Raise funds through legal and University approved means

academicCalendar.structure: Three trimesters or two semesters each consisting of fifteen (15) weeks

admissions.policy: Applications are welcomed from students with excellent academic potential. Applications are considered without regard to ethnicity, nationality, disability, sexual orientation, gender, religious or political beliefs, marital status or socio-economic background.
admissions.requirement: A student will be admitted into a programme if he or she meets the minimum entry requirements and subject to availability of space

requirements: Present Admission letter as proof of admission
Complete KCAU registration form indicating subjects/units for the trimester
Submit unit registration forms at Registrar's office with proof of payment
Student ID card (Smart Card) issued upon filling card request form and proof of fee payment
newStudents.namePolicy: Names shall be as they appear in application documents or National ID. No change in names will be effected after graduation.

continuingStudents.process: Register online through Student Portal at www.kca.ac.ke
continuingStudents.preRegistration: Begins 4 weeks before commencement of new trimester/semester
continuingStudents.addDropPeriod: Within first 2 weeks of new trimester/semester
continuingStudents.academicLeave: Apply not later than week six if unable to register

deferredAdmission.duration: Maximum of three trimesters (one academic year)
deferredAdmission.academicLeave: Maximum period of two academic years, one year at a time
deferredAdmission.deregistration: Students who don't register for academic leave within required deadlines will be deregistered

creditTransferAndExemptions.eligibility: Students from other CUE recognized institutions may apply on credit transfer with testimonials of good standing
creditTransferAndExemptions.applicationTiming: At the time of admission application
creditTransferAndExemptions.fee: A fee will be charged for each credit transferred except for KCAU graduates

modesOfStudy.description: Student attends scheduled day classes on regular basis
Student attends scheduled evening classes regularly
Student attends scheduled weekend classes regularly
Student guided through courses using online instructional materials, assignments, and tutorials

classAttendance.maximumAbsence: Should not miss more than four weeks of expected trimester/semester
classAttendance.responsibility: Every student must ensure their names appear on class registers and sign attendance register

courseProgression.requirement: Student may proceed to next level if progression rules are satisfied
courseProgression.restrictions: Students with pending supplementary results, repeat units, or examination irregularity cases cannot proceed until cleared by University examination board

components: Final examination at end of trimester/semester
assessment.weightingNote: Weighting for course work and final examination based on course regulations

requirementsForPass: Enrolled in accordance with Faculty enrolment regulations
Attended classes and instruction to satisfaction of Senate
Completed oral, practical, written or other tests/assignments
Completed final examination to satisfaction of examiners

conductRules.arrivalTime: At least 15 minutes before examination starts
conductRules.earlyExit: Cannot leave 30 minutes before end unless handing over scripts
conductRules.communication: No communication with other candidates during exam
conductRules.calculators: Electronic, portable, self-powered, noiseless, non-programmable calculators allowed

examTypes.openBook: Candidates may take any written or printed materials including books
examTypes.restrictedBook: Only specified materials allowed, must not be annotated
examTypes.restrictedBookWritten: Specified materials may be annotated, written or typed upon

supplementaryExams.eligibility: Given to candidates who fail in accordance with curriculum
supplementaryExams.timing: Done when next offered upon payment of requisite fees
supplementaryExams.failureConsequence: Must repeat unit when next offered
supplementaryExams.progressionRule: No student shall proceed with more than one pending repeat unit

admissibleReasons: Bereavement of nuclear family member (grandparent, parent, child, spouse, sibling, legal guardian)
Sickness with doctor's letter and prescription
Traveling outside country for work (written notice 2 weeks before exam)
requirements: Clear all fees for preceding semester
Done all CATs and assignments with 2/3 class attendance
Fill and get approval for Special Examination form

examCards.requirement: All students required to have exam card before sitting examinations
examCards.availability: Print from student portal if duly signed nominal roll and cleared financial obligations

appeals.process: Appeal in writing to Chairman of University Senate through HOD and Dean of Faculty
appeals.timeline: Within two weeks after release of results
appeals.outcome: Final grade after remark must be accepted whether higher or lower

eligibility: Clearance from faculty on academic matters
Clearance from Student Finance on financial matters
graduation.certificateCollection: Encouraged to collect within one year, storage charges apply after expiry

library.name: Martin Oduor Otieno Library
library.description: State of the art learning and research Centre with Iconic Pyramidal physical structure that can accommodate over 1500 users in single seating with integrated modern technologies for 21st century virtual library experience. Award winning library with several trophies won in Annual Maktaba Award events since 2011.
services: Safe, comfortable and secure study environment
Off-campus services to E-books and E-Journals

feePaymentRequirements.minimumPayment: At least 50% of total fees at beginning of every trimester/semester
feePaymentRequirements.outstandingDebt: Students with outstanding fees from previous trimester/semester shall not be allowed to register until cleared
feePaymentRequirements.creditManagementFee: Charged on payments made by installments
feePaymentRequirements.interest: Outstanding fees beyond 1 year will attract interest at university determined rate

financialAid.description: Financial aid based on student's financial need and possession of right skills
financialAid.eligibility: Full time students who meet set criteria, must be student for at least one semester
financialAid.terms: Maximum 20 hours per week, paid per hour, fully funded by requesting department

financialAid.description: For needy students who scored KCSE mean grade of A or A-
Awarded on merit to bright but needy students aspiring for excellence
financialAid.coverage: Tuition fees for study period covered by scholarship

examClearance.requirement: All candidates required to have financial clearance by Student Finance office before taking University examinations
examClearance.form: Duly signed and stamped examination card
examClearance.authority: Only Director of Finance or DVC Finance Planning & Administration can authorize exceptions

discounts.application: Apply on tuition fees only, granted on trimester/semester basis
discounts.limitation: Only one category of discount per student
discounts.timing: Can only be claimed within the trimester
discounts.contact: Student Finance offices in respective campuses

studentIDCard.issuance: Issued on reporting day for new students
studentIDCard.activation: Upon payment of fees to access University facilities
studentIDCard.requirement: Must be carried at all times while in University
studentIDCard.ownership: Remains property of university, must be surrendered upon course end
studentIDCard.replacement: Lost, defaced or damaged cards must be replaced immediately at prescribed fee
studentIDCard.exchange: Strictly prohibited, will result in disciplinary action

cardCareTips: Point card at readers, don't press against readers
Keep away from direct sunlight or heat
Don't store close to electromagnetic sources like cell phones

refunds.recipient: Only to sponsor, parent or guardian paying fees
refunds.method: By cheque after written request approval
refunds.sponsorFunds: Funds from CDF, HELB, Ministry of Education cannot be refunded to student, only to sponsor

tuitionComplex: Faculty of Computing and Information Management
School of Post Graduate Studies and Research Extension
School of Business and Public Management
martinOduorOtienoBuilding: Dean School of Graduate Studies office
